Theme System / Design Tokens

Design Tokens

Design tokens are the fundamental variables that define your theme's visual language. LuxeUI provides structured token types for colors, typography, spacing, border radius, and effects.

LuxeColorScheme

Define a complete color palette for your application:

Token Type Description
primary Color Main brand color for primary actions and highlights
secondary Color Supporting brand color for secondary elements
accent Color Accent color for emphasis and call-to-actions
background Color Main background color of the application
surface Color Color for cards and elevated surfaces
text Color Primary text color
textSecondary Color Secondary/muted text color
success Color Success state color (typically green)
warning Color Warning state color (typically amber/orange)
error Color Error state color (typically red)
info Color Informational state color (typically blue)
Swift 
let colors = LuxeColorScheme(
    primary: .blue,
    secondary: .purple,
    accent: .cyan,
    background: Color(hex: "#0A0A0F"),
    surface: Color(hex: "#141420"),
    text: .white,
    textSecondary: .white.opacity(0.7),
    success: .green,
    warning: .orange,
    error: .red,
    info: .blue
)

LuxeTypography

Define your type scale and font weights:

Token Type Default Description
fontSizeXS CGFloat 10 Extra small text (captions)
fontSizeS CGFloat 12 Small text (labels)
fontSizeM CGFloat 14 Medium text (body)
fontSizeL CGFloat 16 Large text (subheadings)
fontSizeXL CGFloat 20 Extra large text (headings)
fontSizeXXL CGFloat 28 Section headings
fontSizeDisplay CGFloat 40 Display text (heroes)
fontWeightRegular Font.Weight .regular Normal weight
fontWeightMedium Font.Weight .medium Medium weight
fontWeightBold Font.Weight .bold Bold weight
lineHeightNormal CGFloat 1.5 Standard line height multiplier

LuxeSpacing

Consistent spacing scale for margins and padding:

Token Default Use Case
xxxs 2pt Hairline spacing
xxs 4pt Tight spacing between related elements
xs 8pt Compact internal padding
s 12pt Small gaps and inner margins
m 16pt Standard padding (common default)
l 24pt Large spacing between sections
xl 32pt Extra large gaps
xxl 48pt Major section spacing
xxxl 64pt Page-level spacing
Swift 
@Environment(\.luxeTheme) var theme

VStack(spacing: theme.spacing.m) {
    Text("Header")
        .padding(.horizontal, theme.spacing.l)
        .padding(.top, theme.spacing.xl)
    
    ContentView()
        .padding(theme.spacing.m)
}

LuxeBorderRadius

Consistent corner radius values:

Token Default Use Case
xs 4pt Subtle rounding (tags, badges)
s 8pt Small elements (buttons)
m 12pt Medium elements (input fields)
l 16pt Large elements (cards)
xl 24pt Extra large (modals, sheets)
full 9999pt Pill shape (circular buttons)

LuxeEffects

Animation and shadow settings:

Token Type Default Description
shadowSmall CGFloat 4 Subtle elevation shadow
shadowMedium CGFloat 8 Standard card shadow
shadowLarge CGFloat 16 Prominent shadow for modals
animationFast Double 0.15 Quick micro-interactions
animationNormal Double 0.25 Standard animations
animationSlow Double 0.4 Emphasis animations
blurRadius CGFloat 20 Standard blur for glassmorphism

Accessing Tokens

Access design tokens through the theme environment:

Swift 
struct MyComponent: View {
    @Environment(\.luxeTheme) var theme
    
    var body: some View {
        Text("Hello")
            // Colors
            .foregroundColor(theme.colors.text)
            .background(theme.colors.surface)
            
            // Typography
            .font(.system(size: theme.typography.fontSizeL, 
                          weight: theme.typography.fontWeightMedium))
            
            // Spacing
            .padding(theme.spacing.m)
            
            // Border radius
            .clipShape(RoundedRectangle(
                cornerRadius: theme.borderRadius.l
            ))
            
            // Effects
            .shadow(radius: theme.effects.shadowMedium)
            .animation(
                .easeOut(duration: theme.effects.animationNormal),
                value: someState
            )
    }
}
Best Practice

Always use design tokens instead of hardcoded values. This ensures consistency across your application and makes theme switching seamless.
